risk_factors.reasoning: His biological parents in a household of size 4 indicates some level of instability and neglect which may contribute to his incarceration
He lived with both biological parents from age 5, so there is no evidence of early childhood trauma or abuse
As an unmarried individual, he may be more likely to engage in high-risk behaviors without a support system
His GED certificate and lack of college education indicate limited access to resources and opportunities for personal growth
He has held only one job, which may suggest a lack of financial stability or support system
His past use of drugs indicates some level of impulsivity and risk-taking behavior
He has expressed feelings of depression but only in the past month, suggesting a more recent onset rather than a chronic condition
His first arrest at age 18 and subsequent arrests suggest a pattern of high-risk behavior
Although he has been convicted, his overall record suggests more recent involvement rather than an established history of offending
